I honestly don't understand how people mix these two up. 'a' and 'an', 'your' and 'you're'. It's like mixing up 'catastrophe' and 'cat ass trophy'.

In examples like 'an historic' versus 'a historic' it depends on the regional dialect that you speak.  Some English speakers pronounce the 'h' as a hard consonant and for others it is silent.  It automatically changes which preceding word you would use.

It is a completely different issue for 'your' and 'you're',
To expand on Minrog's point, if YumaS2Astral is from an area where huge is pranced "uege" then "an huge" is indeed correct.

If the following word starts with a consonant sound, then we say a:

a cat
a game of golf
a human emotion
a very nice lady

If the following word starts with a vowel sound, then we say an:

an apple
an easy job
an interesting film
an old man
an umbrella
I understand that, I just don't understand how you could get these two mixed up.

I don't mind Anivia's movement speed too much--it sucks getting around the map, but it's not too important in combat since you have an instant wall and ever-present CC to play with. While I admit the few other immobile champs we've been seeing recently (Sion, Tahm, and Vel'Koz jump to mind) do have more MS than her, Vel is the only one without an excuse for it, and he's in a perfectly good balance spot.

...I would like to see an improvement to Anivia's basic attacks though. For having such abysmal AD and AS, her attack frames are still among the lowest in the game. Kinda awkward to farm with.
I like her basic attacks. If you make it easier to farm with autos, then youd probably have to lose the 600 range.

Why do you like them? I'm legitimately curious, because compared to pretty much any other mage in the game, Anivia has the most trouble farming, despite being incredibly gold-reliant in order to get her RoA and Seraph's as quickly as possible.

Now, I can understand having bad basic attacks as a weakness. Anivia's a burst mage who specializes in area control, and has rather high damage, fantastic CC, a really good wall, and a revival passive. All this on top of one of the best waveclears in the game, as long as she has enough mana and AP to use it as such.

The problem, then, lies in farming without her ultimate, which is what you'll want to focus on pre-6 anyway. Anivia has incredibly low AD, low enough that farming under her turret is a massive pain. Combined with a low attack speed and moderate projectile speed, and it becomes really easy to whiff the minion. And with slow attack frames, you have to stand (hover?) in a potentially bad spot for noticeably longer than most midlaners to get the attack off, the frustration of which is compounded by her attack sound playing before the crystal launches--the same problem that Quinn and Garen have received complaints about in the past.

I mean, even Karthus got his abysmal attack frames buffed at some point after his VU, despite that he can easily just farm with Lay Waste, and possibly harass the enemy in the process. Why does Anivia deserve such an awkward attack in this environment?

When i used to play a lot of Anivia, i noticed two things: her pre-6 harass sucks, but her pre-6 mana costs/waveclear are amazing. Her pre-6 harass is mostly autoattacks unless you have an opponent that cant dodge the Q, and having 600 range helps. Her windup and recoil animation are very long, and i get that. But if you had a fast auto-animation, you really cant leave her 600 range - id rather have 600 range and a slow animation than, say, 550 range and a fast animation (if we remember Annie, both her 625 range and her attack speed were nerfed when they decided to change her). And its not like Anivia has amazing kill pressure pre-6 to want to get a ton of autoattack harass off. 

Anivia has very little problems farming pre 6, since her Q (if you get both procs off) can clear the casters ridiculously early into the game. You need to clear the melees, and having 600 range allows you to do that safely. Her base AD is fairly normal for a ranged Mage. Its not as bad as Vlad, Fiddle, or Annie, but its not as strong as Morg or Lux. Its also fairly normal in growth. 

Also, in comparison to some other champs, her autoattack isnt abnormally bad. I find that a lot of Mids have horrible auto animations. I find that Malz, Veigar, Heimer, Karthus, and Swain's animations are just as hard to farm with.
